verses.text: In the \w year|strong="H8141"\w* that \w Tartan|strong="H8661"\w* \w came|strong="H0935"\w* unto \w Ashdod|strong="H0795"\w*, (when \w Sargon|strong="H5623"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Assyria|strong="H0804"\w* \w sent|strong="H7971"\w* him,) and \w fought|strong="H3898"\w* against \w Ashdod|strong="H0795"\w*, and \w took|strong="H3920"\w* it;

At the same \w time|strong="H6256"\w* \w spake|strong="H1696"\w* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \w by|strong="H3027"\w* \w Isaiah|strong="H3470"\w* the \w son|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Amoz|strong="H0531"\w*, \w saying|strong="H0559"\w*, \w Go|strong="H3212"\w* and \w loose|strong="H6605"\w* the \w sackcloth|strong="H8242"\w* from off thy \w loins|strong="H4975"\w*, and put \w off|strong="H2502"\w* thy \w shoe|strong="H5275"\w* from thy \w foot|strong="H7272"\w*. And he did \w so|strong="H6213"\w*, \w walking|strong="H1980"\w* \w naked|strong="H6174"\w* and \w barefoot|strong="H3182"\w*.\f + \fr 20.2 \ft by: Heb. by the hand of\f*

And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, Like as my \w servant|strong="H5650"\w* \w Isaiah|strong="H3470"\w* hath \w walked|strong="H1980"\w* \w naked|strong="H6174"\w* and \w barefoot|strong="H3182"\w* \w three|strong="H7969"\w* \w years|strong="H8141"\w* \add for\add* a \w sign|strong="H0226"\w* and \w wonder|strong="H4159"\w* upon \w Egypt|strong="H4714"\w* and upon \w Ethiopia|strong="H3568"\w*;

So shall the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Assyria|strong="H0804"\w* lead \w away|strong="H5090"\w* the \w Egyptians|strong="H4714"\w* \w prisoners|strong="H7628"\w*, and the \w Ethiopians|strong="H3568"\w* \w captives|strong="H1546"\w*, \w young|strong="H5288"\w* and \w old|strong="H2205"\w*, \w naked|strong="H6174"\w* and \w barefoot|strong="H3182"\w*, even with \add their\add* \w buttocks|strong="H8357"\w* \w uncovered|strong="H2834"\w*, to the \w shame|strong="H6172"\w* of \w Egypt|strong="H4714"\w*.\f + \fr 20.4 \ft the Egyptiansâ€¦: Heb. the captivity of Egypt\f*\f + \fr 20.4 \ft shame: Heb. nakedness\f*

And they shall be \w afraid|strong="H2865"\w* and \w ashamed|strong="H0954"\w* of \w Ethiopia|strong="H3568"\w* their \w expectation|strong="H4007"\w*, and of \w Egypt|strong="H4714"\w* their \w glory|strong="H8597"\w*.

And the \w inhabitant|strong="H3427"\w* of this \w isle|strong="H0339"\w* shall \w say|strong="H0559"\w* in that \w day|strong="H3117"\w*, Behold, \w such|strong="H3541"\w* \add is\add* our \w expectation|strong="H4007"\w*, whither we \w flee|strong="H5127"\w* for \w help|strong="H5833"\w* to be \w delivered|strong="H5337"\w* \w from|strong="H6440"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Assyria|strong="H0804"\w*: and how shall we \w escape|strong="H4422"\w*?\f + \fr 20.6 \ft isle: or, country\f*
